text: William George Middleton (1920–1951) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s. Bill 'China' Middleton was a St. George junior player from the Kogarah Wanderers Club. He was graded in 1942 and played two years of first grade. Middleton played right through the 1940s in the lower grades at St. George and after retiring, he was elected on the Club Committee. He is not to be confused with a North Sydney player with the same name during the same era. Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players, 1995. Middleton died suddenly on 2 May 1951 at Kogarah, New South Wales, age 31.Sydney Morning Herald (Death Notice) 3/5/1951 Leading Sydney Jockeys got together on Sunday 10 June 1951 at Prince Alfred Park at Carlton, New South Wales in a goal kicking challenge to raise money for Bill's wife and young family.The Sunday Herald "Jockeys New Role" 10/6/1951 https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/18500685?searchTerm=%22bill%20middleton%22%20%22st.george%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=195|||l-year=1951|||l-month=6 ==References== Category:1920 births Category:1951 deaths Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league players from Sydney Category:Rugby league five-eighths Category:St. George Dragons players
title: Bill Middleton
